info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 27 at 8:31PM MDT until July 27 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM MDT/1000 PM CDT/ FOR EAST CENTRAL YUMA COUNTY IN NORTHEASTERN COLORADO AND NORTHWESTERN CHEYENNE COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN KANSAS... At 830 PM MDT/930 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles south of Wray, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public. Tennis ball size hail was reported west of Wray. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Wray, Laird, Beecher Island and Vernon. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 226 and 252. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
